Apr 7

React.JS Top 10 Articles in March 2017

For the past month, we’ve ranked nearly 1,150 React.JS articles to pick the Top 10 stories (0.9% chance to be included) that can help advance your career.

Topics included in this React list are: Router, Fiber, Redux, MobX, setState, GraphQL, Sketch, React Native, Loading. The lists for JavaScript and Node.JS are published separately in the publication.

Mybridge AI ranks articles based on the quality of content measured by our machine and a variety of human factors including engagement and popularity. This is a competitive list and you’ll find the experience and techniques shared by the experienced Node developers particularly useful.

Rank 1

React-bits: React patterns, techniques, tips and tricks [4,907 stars on Github].

Rank 2

Simple React Development in 2017. Courtesy of Hackernoon and Joshua Comeau, Software developer at Khan Academy

Rank 3

A Cartoon Intro to Fiber [React Conf 2017]. Courtesy of Lin Clark at Mozilla

Rank 4

Build your own React Router v4. Courtesy of Tyler McGinnis, Developer Expert at Google

Rank 5

Functional setState is the future of React. Courtesy of Justice Mba

Rank 6

React Loadable: Component-centric code splitting and loading in React. Courtesy of james kyle

Rank 7

Yes, React is taking over front-end development. The question is why. Courtesy of Samer Buna

Rank 8

MobX vs Redux: Comparing the Opposing Paradigms [React Conf 2017]. Courtesy of Preethi Kasireddy

Rank 9

Sketch: A Playground for React Native. Courtesy of Satyajit Sahoo

Rank 10

Create a Docker dashboard with TypeScript, React and Socket.io. Courtesy of Steve Hobbs and Auth0

No 1) IDE

Reactide: The first dedicated IDE for React web application development

[5,400 stars on Github]

No 2) Offline

Redux-offline: Build Offline-First Apps for Web and React Native

[2,621 stars on Github]

No 3) Transition

React-overdrive: Super easy magic-move transitions for React apps

[1,699 stars on Github]

No 4) Grid

Excel-like data grid component for React

[1,668 stars on Github]

<Course of the Month>

No 1) Redux

Learn Modern React with Redux and develop apps supported by NPM, Webpack, and ES6.

[36,001 recommends, 4.7/5 stars]

No 2) GraphQL

Learn and master GraphQL by building real web apps with React and Node

[3,449 recommends, 4.8/5 stars]

No 2) Beginner

React for Beginners. By Wes Bos

[11,717 recommends]

That’s it for React.JS Monthly Top 10. If you like this curation, read best daily articles based on your programming skills on our iOS App.
